page.title: 03Balderton Hall Farm
page.content: {Balderton Hall Farm}was built in the {16th century}and is now owned by{Mr. {Parker,}whose family have lived there for over one hundred years. The farm has{620 acres,}some of the fields are separate from the farm site.They have {sheep and beef cattle}which are moved indoors during the winter, as well as{wheat,oil_seed rape, barley, beet, {rough grazing, improved grazing and {grass}for silage and hay.The farm uses chemical fertilizers such as Nitrame to obtain better crops.{Three people work on the farm with one part time and they usually{get up}at about {7.30am.}The farm has 13 pieces of machinery and they also sell stock at {Shrewsbury market}and grain to{Wem {Mills.}They have one sheep dog and two other dogs as pets. Mr. Parker enjoys sowing crops but dislikes harvesting them.
